topics.title: What is a Keyboard?
topics.content: A keyboard is an input device used to type letters, numbers, and commands into a computer.

topics.title: Keyboard Layout
topics.content: Most keyboards use the QWERTY layout. Keys are grouped into letters, numbers, function keys, navigation keys, and special keys.

topics.title: Categories of Keys
topics.content: Keys include: Alphanumeric (letters/numbers), Function keys (F1â€“F12), Control keys (Ctrl, Alt, Esc), Navigation (Arrows, Home, End), Numeric keypad, and Special keys like Enter, Shift, Spacebar.

topics.title: Typing Position
topics.content: Place fingers on the home row (ASDF JKL;). Sit upright, wrists straight, and type without looking at the keyboard.

topics.title: Typing Skills Practice
topics.content: Start with letters, then words, then sentences. Daily practice improves speed and accuracy.

topics.title: Function Keys
topics.content: F1 opens Help, F2 renames, F5 refreshes, F11 toggles full screen, etc.

topics.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
topics.content: Examples: Ctrl + C (Copy), Ctrl + V (Paste), Ctrl + Z (Undo), Alt + Tab (Switch windows).

topics.title: Numeric and Symbol Keys
topics.content: The number row and numeric keypad are used for digits, symbols (!, @, #), and calculations.

topics.title: What is a Mouse?
topics.content: A mouse is an input device that moves a pointer on the screen and helps interact with programs.

topics.title: Types of Mouse
topics.content: Mechanical (ball), Optical (light sensor), Wireless (Bluetooth/USB), Touchpad (on laptops).

topics.title: Mouse Buttons
topics.content: Left button (select, click), Right button (context menu), Middle button/scroll wheel (scroll or open links in new tab).

topics.title: Mouse Actions
topics.content: Click (select), Double-click (open), Right-click (options), Drag-and-drop (move items), Scrolling (move page).

topics.title: Drag and Drop
topics.content: Click, hold, and move an item, then release it to drop.

topics.title: Scrolling
topics.content: Use the scroll wheel to move up/down a page or zoom in some apps.

topics.title: Mouse Practice
topics.content: Games and exercises like painting, dragging shapes, and clicking targets improve mouse control.

topics.title: Definition of Hardware
topics.content: Hardware is the physical part of a computer that you can touch.

topics.title: Examples of Hardware
topics.content: CPU, Monitor, Keyboard, Mouse, Printer, Scanner, USB drives.

topics.title: Input Devices
topics.content: Devices used to put data into the computer: keyboard, mouse, microphone, camera.

topics.title: Output Devices
topics.content: Devices used to get results from the computer: monitor, speakers, printer.

topics.title: Storage Devices
topics.content: Hard drives, SSDs, Flash drives, CDs/DVDs, Memory cards.

topics.title: CPU and Memory
topics.content: The CPU is the brain of the computer; RAM stores data temporarily for fast use.

topics.title: Definition of OS
topics.content: An operating system is the main software that manages computer hardware and software.

topics.title: Types of OS
topics.content: Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS.

topics.title: Functions of OS
topics.content: File management, running apps, controlling input/output devices, managing memory and security.

topics.title: Installing an OS
topics.content: Boot with installation media, follow setup, format drives, and install drivers.

topics.title: User Accounts
topics.content: OS allows multiple users with different profiles and passwords.

topics.title: Definition of Software
topics.content: Software is a set of instructions that tell the computer what to do.

topics.title: System Software
topics.content: Includes operating systems and drivers.

topics.title: Application Software
topics.content: Programs like Microsoft Word, games, browsers, media players.

topics.title: Security Software
topics.content: Antivirus, firewalls, and antispyware protect the computer from threats.

topics.title: Utility Software
topics.content: Helps with maintenance: disk cleaners, backup tools, file compressors.

topics.title: Microsoft Word
topics.content: A word processor for typing and editing documents.

topics.title: Microsoft Excel
topics.content: Used for tables, charts, and calculations.

topics.title: Microsoft PowerPoint
topics.content: Used for creating slides and presentations.

topics.title: Microsoft Access
topics.content: Used for managing data with databases.

topics.title: Other Tools
topics.content: Outlook (emails), Publisher (designs).

topics.title: What is the Internet?
topics.content: The internet is a global network that connects millions of computers worldwide.

topics.title: Uses of Internet
topics.content: Education, entertainment, communication, shopping, and research.

topics.title: Web Browsers
topics.content: Examples: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge.

topics.title: Search Engines
topics.content: Examples: Google, Bing, Yahoo. Used to find information.

topics.title: Email Basics
topics.content: Electronic mail is used for sending and receiving messages.

topics.title: Social Media
topics.content: Platforms like Facebook, WhatsApp, TikTok, and YouTube allow people to connect and share.

topics.title: Safe Internet Use
topics.content: Do not share personal details, avoid strangers, use antivirus, and ask adults for help.

topics.title: Passwords
topics.content: Use strong, unique passwords that mix letters, numbers, and symbols.

topics.title: Safe Browsing
topics.content: Avoid unknown websites and do not click on suspicious links.

topics.title: Email Safety
topics.content: Never open unknown attachments. Watch out for scams.

topics.title: Digital Etiquette
topics.content: Be polite online, respect others, and avoid cyberbullying.

topics.title: Protecting Devices
topics.content: Install antivirus and keep systems updated.

topics.title: What is a File?
topics.content: A file stores information like text, pictures, or music.

topics.title: What is a Folder?
topics.content: A folder is used to organize files.

topics.title: File Extensions
topics.content: .docx (Word), .xlsx (Excel), .jpg (Image), .mp3 (Audio).

topics.title: Saving Files
topics.content: Save files with proper names in correct folders.

topics.title: Copy, Cut, Paste
topics.content: Helps move or duplicate files easily.

topics.title: File Backup
topics.content: Keep copies of important files on USB or cloud storage.

topics.title: What is Coding?
topics.content: Coding is writing instructions for computers to follow.

topics.title: Why Learn Coding?
topics.content: It helps problem-solving, logical thinking, and creativity.

topics.title: Block Coding
topics.content: Scratch and Blockly use blocks instead of text.

topics.title: First Scratch Project
topics.content: Make a character move, jump, or talk.

topics.title: Introduction to Python
topics.content: Python uses text commands. Example: print('Hello, World!').

topics.title: Algorithms for Kids
topics.content: An algorithm is a step-by-step plan to solve a problem.

topics.title: What is Multimedia?
topics.content: Multimedia combines text, images, audio, and video.

topics.title: Image Files
topics.content: JPEG, PNG, GIF formats are used for pictures.

topics.title: Audio Files
topics.content: MP3, WAV are used for sound recordings and music.

topics.title: Video Files
topics.content: MP4, AVI are used for movies and lessons.

topics.title: Basic Editing
topics.content: Kids can use Paint, Canva, or simple editors to edit pictures and videos.
